data.body: Although the male ejaculate contains hundreds of millions of sperm cells, $\rule{2.5cm}{0.4pt}$.

answerChoices.body: Only a few hundred of them will reach the vicinity of the egg.
Most will be destroyed by the alkaline environment of the vagina at ejaculation.
Most will be destroyed by capacitation before reaching the oocyte.
Only one will release its acrosomal enzymes to penetrate the outer layers of the oocyte.
